intro: Daubentonia texana, commonly known as the Texas daubenton's plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is found in specific regions of Texas. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white flowers bloom in late spring. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
